recipes.name: Sujebi (Hand-torn noodle soup)
steps: Fill a large pot with 2 litres of cold water. Add 2 sheets pre-cut kelp and 15 anchovies. Bring to the boil, then leave on rolling boil, uncovered at medium heat for 20 minutes.
Put 250g plain flour, 160g cold water, 3g table salt and 12g vegetable oil into a large mixing bowl.
Mix together until combined and then knead for 10-15 minutes until it forms a smooth ball. Cover with cling film and put into the fridge.
Chop the green onion into 1cm wide pieces.

Now to make the noodles - take out the dough, pull and stretch thin pieces of dough and drop into the boiling kelp/anchovy soup. Alternatively, roll the dough out very thin, and use a knife to slice small rectangular pieces of dough. As you pick up each piece, it will stretch thinner. Drop directly into the boiling soup.
Allow the noodles to cook for 10 minutes or until all the noodle pieces are floating.
Add 1 tsp sesame oil and the chopped green onions to the pot and give it a stir.
Transfer noodles and soup into a large bowl for serving. Feel free to add any other toppings such as fish balls, dumplings, etc.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Sauce
steps: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well

recipes.name: Pad Kra Pao sauce
steps: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well

recipes.name: Pad Kra Pao (Thai basil dish)
ingredients: 500g mince pork or turkey, or diced chicken
steps: Saut√© garlic and chili together until fragrant and garlic starts to brown
Add mince/ chicken to the pan. For the mince, keep breaking it up and stirring so the aromatics incorporate to the mince
When meat is 1/2 cooked, add sauce and toss to make sure the sauce incorporates in to the mince well
When meat is 3/4 done, add onions and beans, tossing to incorporate
Put lid on pan and allow beans to cook for 4 minutes
In a separate pan fry your eggs. Thai fried eggs are fried in super hot oil for it to bubble
When beans are cooked, take the pan off heat and stir in the basil
Serve the mince and beans with rice, and put your egg on top

recipes.name: Pizza dough
steps: Mix flour, salt and yeast in a large bowl
Add olive oil and warm milk, mix together
Add warm water
Knead for 5 minutes
Place in warm area for around 1 hour, or until doubled in size

recipes.name: Pesto pasta
steps: Cook 150g pasta in boiling water with some salt
Chop sundried tomates into pieces
Toast 15g pine nuts on a frying pan at medium heat, ensuring to toss frequently to prevent burning
Set pine nuts aside
Pan fry 65g chorizo on medium heat
Set chorizo aside, keeping the fatty oils in the pan
Fry 3 eggs using the chorizo oil in the pan, breaking it up into small pieces
Remove the frying pan from the heat
Once the pasta is cooked, drain the water, keeping 1/8 cup water
Add the pasta, sundried tomates, chorizo, pine nuts and 100g spinach to the eggs in the frying pan
Mix ingredients togethe and, as the spinach softens, add 75g pesto with 1/8 cup water with the pesto
Season to taste with salt and pepper

recipes.name: Kimchi pancake
steps: Mix all ingredients together in a bowl
In a large flat frying pan, heat up some oil on medium-high heat
Spread the mix evenly onto the frying pan
When nicely browned on one side, flip the pancake over
Once fully cooked, cut into squares and serve

recipes.name: Tteokbokki (spicy rice cakes)
ingredients: 2 cups Korean soup stock (dried kelp and anchovy stock), can substitute with other stock
steps: Soak 350g Korean rice cake in warm water for 10 mins
To make the sauce, mix 3 tbsp gochujang, 1.5 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp minced garlic, 1 tsp chilli flakes
Bring to a boil the sauce mix with 2 cups Korean soup stock, Korean rice cakes, 150g Korean fish cakes, 60g onion
Simmer until thick, periodically scraping the base of the pan
Serve with sesame oil, sesame seeds, and green onion

recipes.name: Mexican chicken wrap
recipes.description: Delicious pan-fried chicken pieces seasoned with smoked paprika, ground coriander, black pepper and salt, mixed with vegetables and wrapped in a soft flour tortilla
steps: Give the QUANTITY chicken breast a light coating of cornflour
Heat some oil in a large non-stick frying pan, and fry QUANTIY red onions
As the onions cook, add the chicken. Fry until the chicken is half cooked, then throw in 250g red kidney beans, QUANTITY mushrooms and QUANTITY peppers
Now add QUANTITY smoked paprika, QUANTITY ground coriander, QUANTITY ground cumin, and QUANTITY chilli flakes
Keep stirring, thoroughly mixing all the ingredients and spices
Add a generous amount of black pepper, and salt to taste
Once the ingredients are fully cooked, heat the tortillas over low heat on a large flat pan, or alternatively in a microwave
Add the filling to the wraps, topping with your desired amount of grated cheese and shredded lettuce

recipes.name: Chicken laksa
ingredients: 1 red pepper, cut into thin strips
30g (approx 1 heaped tbsp) Thai red curry paste
steps: Heat some oil in a large saucepan on medium heat
Add &&b&&1 red pepper%%b%%, &&b&&1 clove garlic%%b%%, and &&b&&1/2 spring onion%%b%%, stir and cook for 2 mins
While this is cooking, use a large bowl to soak &&b&&180g egg noodles%%b%% in boiling water
Add &&b&&1 heaped tbsp Thai red curry paste%%b%% and stir for 1 min
Pour in &&b&&200ml coconut milk%%b%% and mix until smooth
Add &&b&&chicken stock powder%%b%% with 400ml boiling water
Stir in &&b&&1 heaped tbsp peanut butter%%b%%
At this point, add sugar, salt, pepper to taste
In a frying pan, heat some oil on medium heat, to cook &&b&&300g chicken thigh%%b%% with the &&b&&lime zest%%b%%
While the chicken is cooking, add the noodles to the laksa. The noodles may soak up some of the coconutty liquid - you can add a splash of water to get it back to a soupy consistency
Once the chicken is done, add the chicken to the laksa
Remove the laksa from the heat and add &&b&&juice from 1/2 lime%%b%%
Add more lime juice salt or pepper to taste
Serve in big bowls, topped with the coriander and the remaining spring onions

recipes.name: Hainanese chicken
steps: Wash QUANTITY rice, spread evenly across a large flat pan
Mix QUANTITY light soya sauce, QUANTITY sesame oil, and 2 cloves garlic (finely chopped) with 220ml water
Pour this into the pan with the rice
Evenly spread QUANTITY spring onion (julienned) and QUANTITY ginger (roughly chopped) over the rice
Prepare and place the 4 chicken legs into the pan
Bring the pan to a boil, cover with a lid, then allow to simmer on low heat for 25-30mins
Once the chicken is fully cooked, remove from the pan
Mix the rice in the pan, so the ginger and spring onions are well incorporated
Serve the rice and chicken, with the QUANTITY cucumber and sweet soya sauce on the side

recipes.name: Ginger scallion chicken
recipes.description: Succulent juicy chicken served with soya sauce infused with fragrant pan-fried spring onion and ginger
ingredients: DOUBLE CHECK QUANTITY 20g spring onion (finely chopped)
DOUBLE CHECK QUANTITY 3 litre cold water
DOUBLE CHECK QUANTITY 3 tbsp light soya sauce
DOUBLE CHECK QUANTITY 1 tbsp sesame oil
steps: Take one cup of uncooked rice, and wash with cold water. Do this three times to remove impurities.
Place rice into the rice cooker and fill to the line corresponding to 1 cup. Alternatively, use the finger trick.
Switch on the rice cooker and set the rice to cook.
Fill a large saucepan with 3 litres of cold water. Bring to the boil.
Put the 4 chicken legs into the water. Put the lid on the saucepan, bring water back to boiling, then turn off the fire.
Set a timer for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, take your 20g spring onion and slice into thin rounds roughly 3mm thick. Place into a small rice bowl.
Take your 5g ginger and finely dice into tiny cubes. Add to the bowl of spring onion.

After 30 minutes is up, check the legs are cooked by stabbing the area closest to the joint with a fork, knife or chopstick. It is best to check the largest chicken leg as it will take the longest to cook. If the juices run clear, the chicken is ready. Drain the water from the saucepan to stop the chicken cooking. Leave the chicken in the warm pan and keep the lid closed so it stays warm. If there is still some blood, then the chicken needs a bit longer. Leave it in the water, close the lid of the pot, and allow to slowly cook in the hot water.
Heat up half a teaspoon of oil in a frying pan. Add the spring onion and ginger, and stir-fry gently until fragrant. Transfer from the pan back into the original spring onion and ginger bowl.
Add 3 tablespoon of light soya sauce and 1 tablespoon of sesame oil to the spring onion and ginger bowl. Set aside.
Place two microwaveable plates into the microwave, and heat for 30 seconds.

The rice and chicken legs should now be ready - if the chicken legs were not cooked earlier, you can test the chicken again using the same method as above. Scoop the rice into a bowl and press down so the rice forms a domed bowl shape. Turn the rice out onto the warmed plate. Repeat for second bowl of rice.
Take the chicken legs from the pan and serve next to the rice. Evenly distribute the spring onion and ginger sauce mix over the chicken thigh.
Serve and enjoy!

recipes.name: Pad Thai sauce
steps: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well

recipes.name: Pad Thai
steps: Scald noodles in a bowl of boiled water for 3 minutes. You don‚Äôt want to cook them fully, just so that they become malleable. Drain and air dry in a colander
Cook the protein so that it‚Äôs 3/4 done and remove from pan. Wipe the pan
Heat a little bit of oil in the pan and add onions and garlic until aromatic
Make a well in the middle and add the egg. Incorporate it with the aromatics as it cooks
Toss in the noodles, breaking them up and cook until softened
Add back the chicken
When chicken is mostly cooked, add in the sauce and cook to distribute evenly. The moisture from this should also soften the noodles
Serve with peanuts and chilli flakes, and a slice of lime if desired

recipes.name: Chicken avocado salad
steps: Roast 1 large sweet potato (diced) in the oven at 180deg for 20 minutes
Toast QUANTITY pine nuts on a frying pan, keep tossing until golden brown
Heat up some oil on a pan to fry QUANTITY bacon or chorizo
Season 350g chicken breast with salt and pepper
Pan fry chicken breast until cooked
Wait for all ingredients to cool down
In a large bowl, mix together QUANTITY lettuce (roughly chopped), chicken, sweet potato, 1 avocado (diced), QUANTITY baby/plum tomatoes (halved), QUANTITY pine nuts, and the bacon

recipes.name: Cashew chicken
steps: Take one cup of uncooked rice, and wash twice with cold water to remove impurities, then cook in a rice cooker
Heat oil in a frying pan on medium heat, and add 2 small onions and 1 clove garlic
Add in 300g chicken thigh to the pan
When the chicken is half cooked, add 200g baby corn and 200g straw mushrooms
After a few minutes, lower the heat and add QUANTITY oyster sauce, mixing well with all the ingredients
Add a little soy sauce and/or salt to taste
When the chicken is cooked, take the pan off the heat, and add cashew nuts
Serve with the rice

recipes.name: Chermoula spice blend
steps: Combine all of the ingredients
Store in an airtight container, in a cool dark place for up to 1 year

recipes.name: Middle Eastern style beef stew
steps: Add some oil to a frying pan on high heat
When the oil is hot, add 1 onion (diced) and 1 clove garlic (finely chopped)
When the onion and garlic have browned, add the beef mince, breaking it up as it cooks
When the beef is 1/2 cooked, add 1 red pepper (thin strips), 1 tbsp chermoula spice, and 500g passata
Bring pan to the boil, then lower the heat to simmer until thick and tomatoey
Put 120g couscous in a large bowl, add lemon zest, a drizzle of olive oil, salt and pepper
Pour 240ml hot (not boiling) water for the couscous, cover tightly with cling film, and set aside
In another fryin pan on high heat (without oil), cook 1 courgette (sliced rounds 1cm thick), charring on both sides
If needed, season the stew with salt and pepper
Fluff up the couscous with a fork and, if needed, add lemon juice to taste
Serve the stew over the couscous in large bowls, add the courgettes, and top with 100g feta cheese (crumbled)

recipes.name: Char Siu (Chinese BBQ) pork
ingredients: Optional: a few drops of red food colouring
steps: Cut pork into long strips, around 5cm wide

To make the marinade, mix together 1.5 tbsp brown sugar, 85g honey, 85g hoisin sauce, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp Chinese five-spice powder, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, and a few drops of red food colouring in a bowl
Place the pork into the bowl of marinade, and leave in the fridge for a minimum of 3 hours, preferably 24+ hours
To roast the pork, preheat the oven to 160deg
Place the pork on a foil-lined tray, saving any marinade in the bowl
Roast pork for 20 mins
While the pork is cooking, pour the marinade into a saucepan. Add 2 tbsp honey and simmer until the marinade is syrupy in consistency
After the initial 20 mins, brush some marinade onto the pork, then turn over. Baste the pork and continue to roast for another 20 mins
Frequently check the pork; if it's started to char, cover it with foil and reduce the temperature
After the second 20 mins, brush more marinade onto the pork, turn, and again brush with marinade
Roast the pork for 10 mins more. The meat should be cooked through, and the top should be caramelised and sticky
Let the pork rest for 10 mins, then brush with the remaining marinade. If necessary, reheat the marinade with 1 tbsp hot water. Slice and serve!

recipes.name: Pei Pa Tofu
steps: Take one cup of uncooked rice, and wash twice with cold water to remove impurities, then cook in a rice cooker
Wash 6 shiitake mushrooms and 100g prawns, or 20g dried shrimps
Soak shiitake mushrooms and dried shrimps in boiling water for 10mins. Prawns do not need soaking
Retain the soaking water, dice the shiitake mushrooms and prawns into small pieces
Press the 500g tofu to remove excess water
Mix together the prawns, mushrooms, 1 spring onions, and 2 cloves garlic in a large mixing bowl
Add 1tsp sesame oil, 1/4tsp / 1g salt, and 1/4tsp / 1g white pepper to the bowl
Add the tofu to the bowl, pressing it to create a paste
Add 3tbsp / 20g cornflour and 1 egg, incorporating well so the mix holds together
Heat up some oil in a non stick frying pan
Using your hands, or two large spoons, scoop together some tofu and place into the pan
Fry for a few minutes on medium heat, and turn to brown the other side
To make the sauce, add 1tbsp / 14g oyster sauce, 1/2tbsp / 4g light soy sauce, and the shiitake soaking water to a saucepan
Bring the saucepan to the oil
Once all the tofu is cooked, serve the rice and tofu with sauce

recipes.name: Pesto crusted cod
steps: Preheat oven to 200 deg
Add potatoes and a pinch of salt to a saucepan of boiling water
Place the carrots on a baking tray, season with salt, pepper and thyme, and a drizzle of oil
Toss the pan to evenly coat the carrots, then roast for 20 mins
Mix 25g panko breakcrumbs, 2 heaped tbsp / 75g pesto, and 1 tbsp vegetable oil in a bowl
Drizzle some oil onto a baking tray lined with foil. With some kitchen towel, pat the cod dry and place on the tray. Press the breadcrumb mix evenly onto the top of the fish
Cook in the oven for around 10 mins

To make the sauce, heat some oil in a pan on medium heat. Add 1 shallot, fry for a few minutes. Add 1 clove garlic, cooking for another minute. Add QUANTITY cider vinegar, cooking until it's evaporated
Add 100ml water and QUANTITY vegetable stock to the sauce, bring to the boil then simmer until reduced by half. Add 30g unsalted butter, stirring until melted in, then remove from the heat
Drain the potatoes. Add butter, salt and pepper to taste, and mash until smooth
Serve the cod, mash potatoes and roasted carrots, with a drizzle of sauce
